denial.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a statement saying that something is not true
denial.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The government issued an official denial of the rumour.
denials that border security had not been strict enough
denial.translation[0].definitions[1].def: when someone refuses to allow someone else to have or to do something
denial.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: protests against the denial of human rights
denial.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a condition in which you refuse to admit or believe that something bad exists or has happened
denial.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: His girlfriend is in denial, and refuses to admit that he will soon die.
denial.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: When the accusation was made, it met with a strong denial.
The report led to vehement denials from the minister involved.
Her categorical denial conflicted with the evidence.
There were angry denials of corruption in the police force.
The Army has consistently issued official denials of involvement.
He refused to make any public denial.
Immediately the government issued a denial of the rumours.
He made no public denial of the allegations against him.
